channel.title: [VB] Question
channel.description: Well, I'm making a text editor in VB6 Does anyone know how I could make a menu item add some text to the text field? Thanks... D_Dign

item.title: [VB] Question
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

text editor is extremely basic, also enterprise comes with a text editor template… that works exactly like notepad…

item.title: [VB] Question
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“d_sign, post:6, topic:156376”]Yeah, that’s what I mean
And what’s so bad about VB? It can create things that get the job done…[/quote][quote="_cake, post:7, topic:156376"][quote author=d_sign link=topic=213349.msg1864178#msg1864178 date=1194115753]
Yeah, that’s what I mean
And what’s so bad about VB? It can create things that get the job done…
[/quote]
The fact there are no actually fully functional pointers or references and it uses ‘end if’ says enough.[/quote]
Yeah, and it teaches general bad coding practice. VB sucks, period.

However of someone is asking for help on something they are trying to learn, you have no right whatsoever to give them shit about it. So unless you have something constructive to provide for the question/conversation/what-ever-it-may-be, keep your meaningless bullshit to yourself. Thank you.

[quote=“h44ckzor pwnage, post:3, topic:156376”]Make your menu item then double click it and and enter Text1.caption = “TEXT HERE”
If your textbox is called something else, Change the text1 to the name.[/quote]
And while I’m at it, isn’t it “Text1.text” to change the text?

Edit: Sorry nevermind, I thought you were talking about text boxes.

Read full topic

item.title: [VB] Question
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote="_cake, post:4, topic:156376"][quote author=h44ckzor pwnage link=topic=213349.msg1863155#msg1863155 date=1194071646]

Ughh.
May I suggest to learn a real language?

VB is a real language and in a topic asking for help, That is not needed.

d_sign:

Make your menu item then double click it and and enter Text1.caption = “TEXT HERE”
If your textbox is called something else, Change the text1 to the name.
[/quote]Oh, excuse me, I’ll leave alone you ‘pro vb coders’ to your business.[/quote]

Don’t try to start a flame war, he’s asking for help, if you can’t help him, then don’t make fun of him if he’s trying to learn something.

@Original post, What do you mean exactly by making a menu item add something to a text field? Do you mean like clicking the menu button and having it append text to the text box?

Read full topic
